item.title: 61 You are Allowed to Say No
item.description:
Hey girl!
 
In this episode, we talk about why you are absolutely, 100% allowed to say no- or any variation of it. We talk about how our trauma and inner child wounds can hold us back from expressing that we do not want to do something. You are allowed to not want to do something. You are allowed to express that you do not want to do something without feeling guilty for how others will respond. Tune into this episode to listen in on more of the conversation!

item.title: 57. Ways Our Ego Tells Us Lies About Ourselves
item.description:
Hey girl!
 
In this episode, we talk about some of the ways our ego tells us lies about who we are. We discuss how some of these lies develop from our childhood. Often times, we feel as though we are broken, as though something is inherently wrong with us, and as though nothing good will ever come our way. We think these lies are our truth when in reality, they are actually lies that come from our ego.

item.title: 6 Sneaky Ways Codependency Shows Up as Perfectionism
item.description:
Hey girl!
 
In this episode, we talk about the 6 sneaky ways codependency can show up as perfectionism. Perfectionism is a coping mechanism often developed from childhood that helps us feel a sense of control and a sense of worth. The truth is our worth is not in what we can produce or how we can produce it. Listen to this episode to discover more about perfectionism and how to release it as a form of self-love and inner child healing

item.title: 55. 7 Signs You May Have A Mother Wound
item.description:
Hey girl!
 
In this episode, we talk about the 7 Signs You May Have A Mother Wound. A "mother wound", in this episode, refers to the emotional damage that you may experience as an adult as a result of having had a relationship with an emotionally abusive, narcissistic, and/or emotionally unavailable parent. We talk about the signs and as always, we talk about how important it is to validate, love, & affirm yourself & your truth, despite it all.

item.title: 52. Quarantine Special: "Why Do I feel so Obsessed and Attached to Them?"
item.description:
Hey girl!

In this episode, we talk about feeling "obsessed" with that potential partner, or that person you are "talking to", or even that person you have been ghosted to (hey what happened to them and why are they ignoring me?) we go into DETAIL about why we panic, why we get obsessed, and why we want more from those that give us less. Hint: it's not you, it's the pattern of thinking you were raised with. Are you ready to dive deep into this topic? I'll see you on the other side!

xx Beatrice

item.title: 28. "All the Stars" Astrology, Love, & Purpose with Astrofashionista
item.description:
Hey girl hey!

In this episode, I chat with professional astrologer Astrofashionista (Tamerri Ater) about the role that astrology plays in our ego, identity, how we act in relationships, love, birth charts, where our reactivity lies in our birth/natal chart, relationships, and of course, passion and purpose! If you have been wondering what exactly is astrology all about and how does it apply to your life... look no further because we cover it ALL in this episode. This is your crash course in astrology & your identity through the lens of astrology, you don't want to miss this!

Please note: ** The terms natal and birth chart can be used interchangeably**

More info about Tameri Ater

Tamerri Ater's Instagram: @astrofashionista 

Tamerri Ater's Facebook: astrofashionista

item.title: 6. You, Too, are Becoming
item.itunes:title: You, Too, are Becoming
item.description:
Hey girl hey! In this episode we get inspired by Auntie Michelle Obama's book, Becoming.

 

-We talk about what it means to be "becoming"

-We discuss two successful celebrity women who decided they would allow themselves to hop on to the journey of becoming

-We discuss what becoming might look like for you and why you should embrace the past, present, and future of this journey.

 

Join me and get into this episode :)

item.title: 5. Releasing Shame
item.itunes:title: Releasing Shame
item.description:
Hey girl hey!

 

In this episode we get into what exactly is shame? How does shame become embedded into our subconscious? What does it look like when we define ourselves by shame? And what does it look like when we define ourselves in rebellion against the shame put forth on us? 

 

BUT most important of all... how do we release that shame?

 

Listen in to find out more! And as always please rate, review, and subscribe!
